questions.question: What is investment casting commonly known as? (LO1)

explanations.a: Investment casting is often called lost-wax casting because it uses a wax pattern to form the mould cavity. The wax pattern is coated with ceramic material to create a hard shell. Once the shell hardens, the wax is melted out and drained, leaving a hollow cavity where molten metal is poured. This technique has been used for centuries and is popular for its ability to create intricate and detailed castings with excellent surface finish.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the ceramic slurry in investment casting? (LO2)

answers.a: To act as a permanent mould for casting
answers.b: To coat the wax pattern and form a hard shell
answers.c: To improve the surface finish of the casting
answers.d: To act as a heat insulator during pouring

explanations.a: The ceramic slurry coats the wax pattern and hardens into a durable shell that serves as the mould for casting. It is heat-resistant and capable of withstanding high temperatures, ensuring that the metal retains its shape as it solidifies. The smooth ceramic surface also improves casting quality, reducing the need for post-processing.

questions.question: How is the molten metal poured into the investment casting mould? (LO2)

answers.d: By mixing the metal with the wax

explanations.a: In most cases, molten metal is poured into the mould using gravity, which ensures a steady and even metal flow into the cavity. However, for intricate parts or reactive metals, vacuum or pressure-assisted pouring is used to improve filling and reduce defects like porosity or inclusions.

questions.question: What happens to the wax pattern after the ceramic shell is hardened? (LO2)

answers.b: It burns and mixes with the molten metal
answers.c: It is melted and drained out of the mould
answers.d: It solidifies and strengthens the mould

questions.question: What is the final step in the investment casting process? (LO2)

answers.a: Breaking the ceramic shell to remove the casting
answers.b: Machining the part into the final shape
answers.c: Recycling the wax for future use

explanations.a: Once the molten metal has solidified, the ceramic shell is broken away using mechanical vibration or water blasting. This reveals the final casting, which may undergo finishing operations such as machining, heat treatment, or surface polishing to meet final specifications.
